skill.name: commit-drafter
skill.description: Automatically draft commit messages by analyzing git status and staged changes
skill.summary: Automatically draft commit messages by analyzing git status and staged changes
skill.author: abereyes

security_audit.summary: This skill is a legitimate git utility. Static scanner found 20 patterns but ALL are false positives. The scanner misidentified Markdown backticks as shell execution, JSON text as cryptographic algorithms, and a source URL as a network vulnerability. The code only runs hardcoded read-only git commands (status, diff, rev-parse) with argument lists and timeouts.

content.value_statement: Writing clear commit messages takes time and interrupts coding flow. This skill analyzes your staged git changes and provides context so Claude can draft meaningful, descriptive commit messages for you to review and use.
actual_capabilities: Analyze staged git changes with git status and diff commands
Extract file change statistics showing insertions and deletions
Categorize files by status: added, modified, deleted, renamed
Provide full diff content for AI analysis
Generate structured output for commit message drafting
Detect change type to suggest appropriate commit prefix
limitations: Requires git repository with staged changes to analyze
Does not execute git commands automatically
Provides context for AI, does not write final commit message
Does not access uncommitted local file content

best_practices: Stage specific files before using this skill for focused commit messages
Review the drafted message before committing to ensure accuracy
Combine with conventional commits format for team consistency
anti_patterns: Using without staging changes first results in no files to analyze
Accepting drafted messages without reviewing the diff context
Skipping commit message entirely defeats the purpose of version control

faq.question: Does this skill modify my git repository?
faq.answer: No. The skill only reads git status and diff information. It does not stage files, create commits, or modify history.

faq.question: What git commands does this skill run?
faq.answer: It runs read-only commands: git status --short, git diff --staged, and git diff --staged --stat.

faq.question: Can this skill work with any git hosting service?
faq.answer: Yes. It works locally with any git repository regardless of hosting platform like GitHub, GitLab, or Bitbucket.

faq.question: Is my code or secrets exposed when using this skill?
faq.answer: Only staged changes are analyzed. Uncommitted changes and secrets in working files are not accessed.

faq.question: What if I have no staged changes?
faq.answer: The skill returns an error message telling you to stage files first using git add.

faq.question: How is this different from template-based commit tools?
faq.answer: Template tools output placeholders. This skill provides actual change context so Claude writes meaningful messages describing real code changes.
